sentence.Network_en: He removed the dogmatism from politics; he erased the party line.
sentence.Network_cn: 他根除了政治中的教条主义, 消除了政党界限.

sentence.Network_en: Dogmatism is puppyish coming to its full growth.
sentence.Network_cn: 教条主义是盲目自高自大的全副面目.

sentence.Network_en: We want to get away from the politics of outdated dogmatism and class confrontation.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们想摒弃过时的教条主义和阶级对抗的政治观点。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: via French from medieval Latin dogmatismus, from Latin dogma (see dogma)

entry.def: If you refer to an opinion as dogmatism, you are criticizing it for being strongly stated without considering all the relevant facts or other people's opinions.

example.ex: We cannot allow dogmatism to stand in the way of progress.
example.tran: 我们不能允许教条主义阻碍进步。

means.word_mean: 1. the intolerance and prejudice of a bigot

auth_sentence.content: If they are judicious they will fault our dogmatism.
auth_sentence.res_content: If they are judicious they will fault our dogmatism.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: If they are judicious they will fault our dogmatism.

auth_sentence.content: Perhaps the scientific method and democracy can replace dogmatism and theocracy.
auth_sentence.res_content: Perhaps the scientific method and democracy can replace dogmatism and theocracy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Perhaps the scientific method and democracy can replace dogmatism and theocracy.

auth_sentence.content: Such dogmatism and imperviousness to evidence are hallmarks of the authoritarian mind.

sentences.en: That is one reason why we have remained opposed to dogmatism toward the theory of Marxism.
sentences.cn: 这就是我们为什么必须始终反对以教条主义的态度对待马克思主义理论的道理所在。
